text: I'm keeping busy how about you you got
more debate prep tonight oh we had a
debate tonight no driver problem while
the presidential candidates kept pace
with their hectic schedules on Monday a
team at Fox News was hunkered down in
debate preparation this is jeremy peters
of the new york times i had the
opportunity to spend the day shadowing
bret baier and his fox news colleagues
as they made final preparations for
monday's debate
okay putting on a debate as a massive
editorial and logistical undertaking and
as the primary season moves along each
one has higher stakes this is mr. bear's
fifth debate this season and for each
one it becomes more difficult trying to
get the candidates off of their
well-worn talking points they write that
you were embarrassing yourself by taking
the Obama line how do you respond that
mr. bear is wrestling with the central
dynamic of the race so far mr. Romney's
building an aura of inevitability around
his candidacy even as many conservatives
have deep misgivings about the former
Massachusetts governor okay the team
worked to script the debate as tightly
as possible leaving little to chance yet
they were thrown a last-minute curveball
when Jon Huntsman withdrew from the race
just hours before the debate began but
as it turned out his absence gave the
moderator a new way to ask an old
question Governor Romney governor
Huntsman endorsed you today but in New
Hampshire he called you a quote
perfectly lubricated weather vane on the
important issues of the day and just
last week governor Huntsman charged that
it's hard to find your core which leads
to our first Twitter question mr. Romney
largely seemed to parry the questions
from mr. bear and the attacks from his
rivals with little damage to his
presidential prospects three more
debates are scheduled to be held in the
next nine days and teams from CNN and
NBC will likely wrestle with a similar
dynamic expect mr. Romney to be center
stage but at this point will there be
any new questions to ask
you
